Apple___Apple_scab: Caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis. It thrives in wet, cool conditions.
Apple___Black_rot: Caused by the fungus Diplodia seriata. It affects apples in warm, humid weather.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust: Caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. It requires both apple and cedar trees to complete its life cycle.
Apple___healthy: No disease symptoms present. Regular care helps maintain health.
Blueberry___healthy: No disease symptoms present. Proper soil and moisture levels are crucial.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew: Caused by the fungus Podosphaera clandestina. It thrives in warm, dry conditions.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis. It is common in hot, humid conditions.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_: Caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi. It is prevalent in warm, humid conditions.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight: Caused by the fungus Exserohilum turcicum. It affects corn in cool, wet conditions.
Grape___Black_rot: Caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii. It thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles): Caused by a complex of fungi, including Phaeoacremonium aleophilum. It leads to vine dieback.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo: Caused by the fungus Isariopsis clavispora. It affects grape leaves in humid conditions.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening): Caused by the bacterium Candidatus Liberibacter asiaticus, transmitted by the Asian citrus psyllid.
Peach___Bacterial_spot: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris. It affects peaches in warm, wet conditions.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas campestris. It affects peppers in warm, humid conditions.
Potato___Early_blight: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It affects potatoes in warm, humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight: Caused by the fungus Phytophthora infestans. It thrives in cool, moist conditions.
Squash___Powdery_mildew: Caused by the fungus Podosphaera xanthii. It thrives in warm, dry conditions.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch: Caused by a variety of factors, including heat stress and inadequate watering.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Caused by the bacterium Xanthomonas perforans. It affects tomatoes in warm, wet conditions.
Tomato___Early_blight: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani. It affects tomatoes in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Late_blight: Caused by the fungus Phytophthora infestans. It thrives in cool, moist conditions.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Caused by the fungus Passalora fulva. It affects tomatoes in high humidity.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Caused by the fungus Septoria lycopersici. It affects tomatoes in warm, humid conditions.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two-spotted_spider: Caused by the Two-spotted spider mite, which thrives in hot, dry conditions.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola. It affects tomatoes in warm, wet conditions.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: Caused by a virus transmitted by whiteflies. It leads to yellowing and curling of tomato leaves.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: Caused by a virus that leads to mottled, discolored leaves.
